result.execSummary:
The defendant Absalom B Israel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $550.00, payable to Norman F. and $925.00 payable to Sharon R.

Court ordered all to be paid by the end of Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered that all Court costs, fines, surcharges and/ or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due & owing is subject to civil judgment and or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/ Maintain full-time employment/ education/ vocation
As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm and may not vote until his civil rights have been restored

NO CONTACT with the victim as specified in the Complaint or with their residence.
NO alcohol.   
NO drugs.

Provide a DNA sample.  
Follow all rules of Supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the Probation department.
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence and to Count 1

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes:
***4-27-15, Judge Witkowiak:  Court ordered the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include 62 days of sentence credit on count three.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence/ Counts

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Absalom B Israel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) commencing APRIL 7, 2015 received and filed.
Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (34 pages) commencing APRIL 7, 2015 received and filed. kl
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Letter from DOC regarding sentence credit on count three.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

At to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2.5 YEARS with 62 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence and Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/counts.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: The Victim as specified in the Complaint or their residence.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $550.00 payable to Norman F. and $925.00 payable to Sharon R.; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statements    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Absalom B Israel in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Absalom B Israel in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to Counts 1, 2, and 3 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Absalom B Israel not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Absalom B Israel in court with attorney Colin McGinn for Michael Jude.  Defendant Absalom B Israel in custody.  Ron Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Pollard-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Sharon R; Nakiiya W; Kevin R;  Celeste Q; Norman F; Cesas CD.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Absalom B Israel in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  
Defendant Absalom B Israel in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
